meanings.definition: The electrode in a vacuum tube that emits electrons.
meanings.sent1: The anticathode glowed brightly as it released electrons.
meanings.sent2: Technicians carefully examined the anticathode for any signs of damage.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous robot mistook the anticathode for a shiny button.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like an anticathode in a dark tunnel.
meanings.sent5: The anticathode hummed with energy, ready to power the device.

meanings.definition: The point on the surface of a body where the axis of an optical system intersects.
meanings.sent1: The anticathode of the telescope focused the light to a single point.
meanings.sent2: Scientists adjusted the anticathode to improve the clarity of the image.
meanings.sent3: The detective followed the clues, leading him to the anticathode of the mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like the anticathode of truth, revealing everything in their gaze.
meanings.sent5: The anticathode of the mirror reflected her image back perfectly.
